title: Josep Espuga serves up mouth-watering Hamilton Island life
text:
Josep Espuga serves up mouth-watering Hamilton Island life 14th Jul 2015 12:00 AM Hamilton Island Yacht Club chef Josep Espuga loves to creates delicious sweet and savoury combinations in his culinary fare. Related Items Cars For Sale 
SURE there's the sunshine, the idyllic island sunsets and the luxury accommodation. 
But, just like Josep Espuga, Executive Chef at Hamilton Island Yacht Club, guests are smitten with the international-style cuisine. 
With the young Spaniard at the helm, Bommie restaurant is one of the fine dining offerings on Hamilton Island and delights diners with dishes such as quail with foie gras ice cream, oreo crumb and lemon aspen and reef fish with clams, Jamon air, squid ink and mango. 
"I think these are dishes that define my style of cooking very well," says Mr Espuga, who has honed his culinary skills in the finest kitchens in Barcelona and New York to Hong Kong and Shanghai. 
"I have loved mixing sweet and savoury since I was a child. My favorite snack was potato crisps with chocolate bars." 
As for the quail, the chefs explains: "I like this dish because of the combination of flavours and also because we combine an European product (foie gras) with an Australian product (lemon aspen)." Reef fish with clams, Jamon air, squid ink & mango. Photo: Hamilton Island 
Mr Espuga's tantalising creations are always based on local ingredients and inspired by his environment, in this case the island colours and the beauty of the reef. 
"Some of our diners say our reef fish dish looks like a piece of coral," he says. 
"The building where the restaurant is sited is also inspirational. We try to make our food look as beautiful as the architecture." 
On a daily basis, Mr Espuga rises as early as possible to admire the magic sunrise and stunning views of tropical Hamilton Island. 
Once at the Yacht Club, he first visits the kitchen garden where he waters the herbs and vegetables that are used as part of the fine dining menu. 
"We have mustard, nasturtium leaves and flowers, garlic chives, shiso, coriander and the last thing we have planted are pumpkins. Glazed duck with ginger pears, horseradish icecream, burned leeks & Guinness 
"We also buy and use Australian native products like lemon aspen, salt bush, native thyme, karkalla and kangaroo." 
While his days generally stretch to 11pm, when the last satiated diner has left the club, on his days off he likes to take part in the variety of activities, to walk around the island paradise or get out onto the water. 
"Sometimes I take a ride on someone else's boat; at others I rent a little dinghy and go fishing. 
"I'm also taking golf lessons on Hamilton Island's golf course on Dent Island, just 10 minutes by boat." 
To follow Josep on Instagram go to @josepespuga or to find out more about the chef on josepepuga.com .
